page.title: 11Sidmouth Golf Club
page.content: A narrow 18 hole Par 66, 5188 yard long course running inland from the sea under Neroche forest(approx S to N)It slopes from the West(edge of the forest) to the East(Bickwell Valley) Formed in 1889 the original small,red club house stands near the 13th hole. There are spectacular views from the elevated 10th tee down the valley to the sea.The course was created on land owned by Lord Balfour (Lord of the Manor) The original first hole is now the 6th hole.The course machinery is kept in Lord Balfour's former kennels. It is watered by natural spring water running from the forest and is now channelled from a well near the 13th hole. A beautiful well kept but difficult course due to the slope Sidmouth Golf Club retains many original trees which present natural hazards to players.
